meanings.definition: To reduce the official value of a currency in relation to other currencies.
meanings.sent1: The government devaluates the currency to help exports.
meanings.sent2: When a country devaluates its currency, it can attract more tourists.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick devaluates the importance of money in the audience's eyes.
meanings.sent4: Her constant complaining devaluates the value of her words.
meanings.sent5: The storm's destruction devaluates everything in its path.

meanings.definition: To diminish the worth or importance of something.
meanings.sent1: Constant criticism devaluates the efforts of hardworking individuals.
meanings.sent2: Ignoring someone's achievements devaluates their hard work.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly antics devaluates the seriousness of the situation.
meanings.sent4: His careless actions devaluates the trust others have in him.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the monument devaluates its historical significance.
